newsitem.title: USA: Brooks Fiber completes merger in Texas.
newsitem.headline: Brooks Fiber completes merger in Texas.

text.p: Brooks Fiber Properties Inc said Tuesday it completed its merger with Metro Access Networks Inc, Century Telephone Enterprises Inc's local exchange carrier in Texas.
The merger consists of networks in seven Texas cities, including operating networks in Dallas, Ft. Worth, San Antonio and Austin and networks under development in Houston, Corpus Christi and Waco.
In exchange, Century will receive 4.3 million shares of Brooks Fiber common stock and will have representation on Brooks Fiber's board of directors.

"This partnership provides us with an excellent opportunity to expand our national coverage and establish a strategic market presence in Texas, the third largest telecommunications state in the country," James Allen, Brooks Fiber chief executive officer, said in a statement.
Brooks Fiber is a full service provider of local telecommunications services.
